author: roessland
body:
<!--

For Windows PowerShell 5.1 issues, suggestions, or feature requests please use the following link instead:
Windows PowerShell [UserVoice](https://windowsserver.uservoice.com/forums/301869-powershell)

This repository is **ONLY** for PowerShell Core 6 and PowerShell 7+ issues.

- Make sure you are able to repro it on the [latest released version](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/releases)
- Search the existing issues.
- Refer to the [FAQ](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/docs/FAQ.md).
- Refer to the [known issues](https://docs.microsoft.com/powershell/scripting/whats-new/known-issues-ps6?view=powershell-6).

-->

# Steps to reproduce

```powershell

PowerShell 7.0.0-rc.3
Copyright (c) Microsoft Corporation. All rights reserved.

https://aka.ms/powershell
Type 'help' to get help.

Loading personal and system profiles took 1999ms.
(base) C:\Program Files\PowerShell\7-preview> get-command code
Get-Command: The term 'code' is not recognized as the name of a cmdlet, function, script file, or operable program.
Check the spelling of the name, or if a path was included, verify that the path is correct and try again.
(base) C:\Program Files\PowerShell\7-preview> echo $env:path
[...omitted...]C:\Users\AndreasR°ssland\AppData\Local\Programs\Microsoft VS Code\bin;
(base) C:\Program Files\PowerShell\7-preview> $env:PATH=$env:PATH.Replace("°", "ø")
(base) C:\Program Files\PowerShell\7-preview> get-command code

CommandType     Name                                               Version    Source
-----------     ----                                               -------    ------
Application     code.cmd                                           0.0.0.0    C:\Users\AndreasRøssland\AppData\Local\P…

(base) C:\Program Files\PowerShell\7-preview>
```

# Expected behavior

$env:path contains `ø` and not `°`.
Just like normal PowerShell (non-Core).

# Actual behavior

$env:path has `ø` replaced with `°` and cannot find VS Code in path due to this problem.

# Environment data

<!-- provide the output of $PSVersionTable -->

```none
(base) C:\Program Files\PowerShell\7-preview> $PSVersionTable

Name                           Value
----                           -----
PSVersion                      7.0.0-rc.3
PSEdition                      Core
GitCommitId                    7.0.0-rc.3
OS                             Microsoft Windows 10.0.18363
Platform                       Win32NT
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0…}
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1
WSManStackVersion              3.0
```

comments.author: roessland
comments.body:
Silly workaround.

```
C:\Users>mklink /D AndreasRssland AndreasRøssland
symbolic link created for AndreasRssland <<===>> AndreasRøssland
```

Then just add paths without ø to path. Works as expected.

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body: @roessland Please see the PATH env variable in cmd.exe and confirm that there is no issue.

comments.author: roessland
comments.body:
Opening cmd.exe from start menu:

```
C:\Users\AndreasRøssland>code

C:\Users\AndreasRøssland>echo works fine
works fine

C:\Users\AndreasRøssland>echo %path%
[...omitted...];C:\Users\AndreasRøssland\AppData\Local\Programs\Microsoft VS Code\bin;
```



Running pwsh from cmd.exe:

```
C:\Users\AndreasRøssland>"C:\Program Files\PowerShell\7-preview\pwsh.exe"
PowerShell 7.0.0-rc.3
Copyright (c) Microsoft Corporation. All rights reserved.

https://aka.ms/powershell
Type 'help' to get help.

Loading personal and system profiles took 1060ms.

(base) C:\Users\AndreasRøssland> code
code : The term 'code' is not recognized as the name of a cmdlet, function, script file, or operable program.
Check the spelling of the name, or if a path was included, verify that the path is correct and try again.
At line:1 char:1
+ code
+ ~~~~
+ CategoryInfo          : ObjectNotFound: (code:String) [], CommandNotFoundException
+ FullyQualifiedErrorId : CommandNotFoundException

(base) C:\Users\AndreasRøssland> echo $env:path
[...omitted...];C:\Users\AndreasR°ssland\AppData\Local\Programs\Microsoft VS Code\bin;.
```

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body: You could start pwsh -noprofile from cmd.exe and check again.

comments.author: roessland
comments.body:
Thank you. Seems like this is a bug in `conda activate`, in the function Enter-CondaEnvironment.

Feel free to close.

title: $env:path has special character ø in paths replaced by °
